title: Tracking issue for deprecation lint `legacy_derive_helpers`

labels.name: A-lint
labels.description: Area: Lints (warnings about flaws in source code) such as unused_mut.

labels.name: A-macros
labels.description: Area: All kinds of macros (custom derive, macro_rules!, proc macros, ..)

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: C-tracking-issue
labels.description: Category: A tracking issue for an RFC or an unstable feature.

body:
This is a tracking issue for deprecating code like this:

```rust
#[trait_helper] // This helper attribute is used before it introduced by `#[derive(Trait)]` below.
#[derive(Trait)]
struct S;
```

Code like this works for historical reasons, but attribute expansion works in left-to-right order, so we have to use some hacks and "look into the future" to resolve `trait_helper`, but that future may never actually happen in cases like
```rust
#[trait_helper]
#[remove_all_derives] // removes the `#[derive(Trait)]` below
#[derive(Trait)]
struct S;
```
, so the resolution in this case is unreliable.

A deprecation lint for this case is added in https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/79078 as warn-by-default.
